Hence!  avaunt, corroding care!</br>Let content and peace be here;</br>Ease (ally'd to sisters three,</br>Leisure, hope, and liberty,)</br>Winged mirth, who laughing flies,</br>With dimpled cheeks and roguish eyes;</br>Or in more methodic hour,</br>Welcome contemplation's power.

Lo!  the muse, by fancy led,</br>Joyous seeks the rustic shed,</br>Flys from what the world calls gay,</br>Here the hermit's part to play;</br>At her beck the Dryads move,</br>Sporting thro' the "checquer'd grove;"</br>(Fauns with ivy garlands crown'd,)</br>Gambol o'er the verdant ground,</br>While, constrain'd by fancy's spell,</br>Sylphs and fairies haunt the cell.

Here the muse, remote from noise,</br>Soft tranquility enjoys;—</br>Envys not the fair and vain,</br>Who mix in fashion's busy train,</br>But wishes, undisturb'd, to prove</br>A life of reason, and of love.</br>
